text:
*[Bug 18986] Short-circuit crossprod and tcrossprod with ddot BLAS*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18986>

--- Comment #4 from mgarb (<mailto:jan.garbuszus@ruhr-uni-bochum.de|jan.garbuszus@ruhr-uni-bochum.de>) ---
Following Dirk’s suggestion, I’ve set up a GitHub repository to validate
various BLAS implementations. [1] The workflow runs several checks on an R
function calling the BLAS ddot routine. Current tests are passing; please let
me know if there are additional BLAS versions or specific edge cases I should
include.

[1]
<https://github.com/JanMarvin/test_blas/blob/main/.github/workflows/blas_test.yml>

elements.text: [Bug 18986] Short-circuit crossprod and tcrossprod with ddot BLAS

) ---
Following Dirk’s suggestion, I’ve set up a GitHub repository to validate
various BLAS implementations. [1] The workflow runs several checks on an R
function calling the BLAS ddot routine. Current tests are passing; please let
me know if there are additional BLAS versions or specific edge cases I should
include.

[1]

text:
*[Bug 18979] method for implicit generic 'norm' (x="ANY", type="missing") does not dispatch*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18979>

Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
             Status|CONFIRMED                   |CLOSED

--- Comment #2 from Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) ---
Fixed with svn rev 89211 (Dec 22); 

currently *not* marked to backport to the R 4.5.x branch,
but that may be reconsidered once/when we know if that change has had "gotchas"
in package space or similar.
It is a clear bug fix .. though not reported for years.
